intro: Didymocarpus geitleri, commonly known as the Sierra madre pittosporum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pittosporaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its fruits are small, woody capsules that split open to release seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
